intro: Stenaria mullerae subsp. pooleana, commonly known as the Poole's stenaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, daisy-like flowers with yellow central disk and white to pale pink ray florets. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal or maritime environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and is known for its resilience to salt spray and wind. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological adaptations and limited distribution.
